oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Account Form No. 22 from the United States Army Quartermaster to Private B. P. Pool of Company A, 27th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry, for extra duty service as a wagoner for ninety-one days- September, October, and November of 1862- at twenty-five cents a day. Signed by Captain Simon Perkins Jr., U. S. Army Quartermaster's Office.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. "Extra Duty" includes any services performed outisde the normal duties of a soldier within a military unit. These could include engineering, mechanic services, and other labor. Extra duty nearly always came with specific payment.
